view

Class GUI

  • java.lang.Object
    • view.GUI

  • public class GUI
extends java.lang.Object
    Responsible for initializing the game look and feel, hooking up buttons to OS messages and running the main game loop.
    Author:
    Tadas

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      (package private) class  GUI.LoadGame
      Button object.
      (package private) class  GUI.NewGame
      Button makes the operator software create a new power plant.
      (package private) class  GUI.RestartButton
      Button for restarting the operator software.
      (package private) class  GUI.SaveGame
      Button object.
      (package private) class  GUI.ScoresButton
      Button object.
      (package private) class  GUI.StepButton
      Implements Step button functionality.
      (package private) class  GUI.ViewSwitchButton
      These buttons are used for changing the content to be displayed in the sidebar.

    • Constructor Detail

      • GUI

        public GUI(PlantController controller)
        Initializes all the graphics and UI side of things
        Parameters:
        controller - reference to the plant controller that will be represented by the GUI.

    • Method Detail

      • run

        public void run()
        Main game loop. Tracks the time that has passed between each cycle. Asks the user to enter a new operator name first. This function must be run to actually start rendering and updating the window

      • getRenderer

        public Renderer getRenderer()
        Returns a reference to the renderer, ideally does not need to be used at all.
        Returns:
        reference to the main renderer

      • reset

        void reset()
        Resets a bunch of internal values that get set when the game over screen is reached. Gets called whenever a new game is started or loaded.

      • updateGraphics

        void updateGraphics()
        Adds all the objects that need to be rendered to the rendering queue. Automatically called in the run() function every frame.
